title: Sales Manager (South Island)
description:
Connecterra is a diverse team of pioneers working to solve one of the hardest challenges the planet faces today: Agriculture Efficiency. We are the proud inventors of Ida, a digital assistant for farmers that uses data and machine learning to help support farmers and their stakeholders improve farm efficiency.  

Ida has demonstrated that she can help improve productivity by over 20% and is growing rapidly. Learn more about Ida here.  

Headquartered in Amsterdam, The Netherlands, we operate in 18 countries globally. Check out our press coverage and Ida growth track record.

As a part of our global expansion plans, we are now hiring for talent in New Zealand.

 
Our hiring ethos: 
 
We seek only the best and brightest who have a hunger to excel in their craft and will make a positive & unique addition to our culture and team. Your attitude and commitment to working as a part of this team to come up with new ideas, solve problems and deliver results is what matters most to us.  

Our team is highly motivated, engaging, fun and supportive. We work as a team but hold each other accountable to our responsibilities.  

We offer you a platform to do the best work of your life, be involved with an interesting product and part of a unique, diverse and collaborative environment, your genuine desire to be an integral part of our mission means a lot to us.  


You’re our Sales Manager:


You’re an experienced sales manager who has an entrepreneurial spirit along with a start-up mentality. You have previously worked with dairy farmers in converting initial business conversations to sales, onboarding new customers, driving the right outcomes, and delivering value for all parties will be second nature to you. You’ll have vast knowledge of the dairy farming industry from end to end.

You’ll be responsible for developing trusted networks & relationships with farmers and working with our partners. This is a unique opportunity for you drive your own success and development in this new opportunity for Connecterra with the full backing of the local NZ and HO team in Amsterdam.

This role is work from 'home’, you’ll be mostly based from your home office and required to travel to potential customers across all corners of the country, with main focus on the South Island.
requirements:
Primary Responsibilities 

  1. Win deals. Own and deliver on an annual sales quota.
  2. Work with our partners to qualify opportunities and engage with dairy farmers.
  3. Move deals from initial qualification to closed-won pipeline stage.
  4. Keep your local account team aligned between partners, customer success and support.


Soft Skills 

  • Self-sourcing new business leads through multiple ways including cold calling, networking, referrals, referral partners/events etc.
  • Managing relationships and increasing the value of existing customers.
  • Aptitude for rapport building with demonstrable prospecting skills and the ability to identify and convert opportunities, you’re a proven closer with a demonstratable track record and strategic approach
  • Ability to work autonomously & as part of a team
  • Able to manage sales pipeline
  • Analytical, proactive, commercial mindset
  • Outstanding planning, organisational & follow up skills.

Requirements

  • 5 years + experience within a similar role, solution sales with strong business development, planning, and financial management skills
  • Ideal but not necessary, prior experience in selling technology to farmers.
  • Knowledge of CRM systems
  • Full NZ drivers license


We offer: 

Every day we work hard on making the world a better place, thus the happiness and well-being of our team members is important to us. We currently offer the following:

  • A diverse, open minded and creative working environment where all are welcome.
  • Competitive package
  • Car subsidy or lease option (details TBC)
  • Flexible working hours and vacation policy - we trust you and your time is yours to own. Work in an environment and on a schedule that suits you and your team best & enjoy unlimited holiday days
  • Wellness Benefit
  • WFH Reimbursement
  • Quarterly company-wide Selfie Day - take a day on us to relax, do what you need to do to stay mentally healthy!
  • The opportunity to play a vital role in an exciting start-up - we welcome your voice & input

As we grow as a company this list will also grow.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
We are Connecterra:

By the year 2050, the world population will be over 9 billion. To provide for so many, food production needs to increase significantly. At this time over a billion people work in agriculture, half of them are farmers. Our technology helps them scale and feed the world.  


As a full-stack technology company, our engineering challenges range from designing hardware sensors to building a machine learning platform. We have developed a farmers’ assistant that can run a dairy farm more effectively than a human. We call it Ida. She learns the behaviour of farmers and cows and provides guidance on making better decisions.  Learn more about us here or check out our press coverage.


You're our Frontend Developer

You will strive to implement and maintain secure , tested application from a front end perspective , frequently liaising with other teams from various disciplines.

  • Work with Product, Design, Backend and Data Science teams to scope, build, and launch new customer-facing features
  • Write modular, well-tested front-end applications which scale
  • Use your knowledge to set best practices for the team
  • Use the different design patterns of frontend frameworks
  • Build solutions for problems you may not find on Stack Overflow
  • Maintain your code and keep complexity under control
requirements:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience
  • Know the basics: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript and responsive web design
  • Have a solid understanding of TypeScript, React, Redux and their infrastructure
  • Ability to understand and work with complex data structures
  • Know the principles of clean code and write documentation
  • Have an irresistible urge to keep unit test coverage high
  • Feel at home with version control (e.g., Git), code reviews, and CI/CD
  • Experience integrating with RESTful API microservices
  • Familiarity with relational and non-relational databases (MongoDB, Microsoft SQL Server)
  • Be a critical thinker who can propose solutions and challenge your colleagues by asking the right questions 


Your tech crew

The Connecterra Engineering and Tech Team is at the core of our company. They keep all systems running and build powerful housing for our AI to grow and learn. Most importantly, they are a key component in the company’s strategic development.


The technology stack

We have an eclectic mix of technologies and languages in our stack, but we are working on converging towards a unified stack for easier maintenance. Our tech stack spans React in TypeScript, Angular, .NET, Python, Java, and a host of open-source platforms. You will have a say in setting the direction of evolving our technology stack; just come prepared with solid arguments! 


We offer:

Every day we work hard on making the world a better place, thus the happiness and well-being of our team members is important to us. We currently offer the following:

- A diverse, open minded and creative working environment where all are welcome
- Competitive package

- Company pension

- Flexible working hours and vacation policy - we trust you and your time is yours to own. Work in an environment and on a schedule that suits you and your team best & enjoy unlimited holiday days

- Quarterly company-wide Selfie Day - take a day on us to relax, do what you need to do to stay mentally healthy!

- The opportunity to play a vital role in an exciting start-up - we welcome your voice & input

- Fantastic office space in Amsterdam with a nice panoramic view
- Optional catered lunch plan + fruits & snacks at your disposal
- A fridge filled with all kinds of drinks to enjoy with your teammates!

As we grow as a company this list will also grow.


Click Apply if you'd like to be a part of our mission!

You're our People lead - Senior People Business Partner 

We are currently looking for a professional who will be responsible for the overall management of our People & HR function as well as being a Sr business partner to our team. People are core to our business, and this is a role where you are integral part at Connecterra. You are passionate about People & HR and have a track record in attracting and developing talent. 

You will oversee and actively contribute strategically as well as operationally to all parts of the People & HR-Cycle including the hiring process, on- and off-boarding of new employees and all matters related. You will be manager to our People Operations officer and collaborate closely with her on executing the strategy that you set in alignment with the leadership team. We are looking for someone who can use their expertise to help us ensure smooth operations, find the right talent, shape our culture and keep employee engagement high. We currently work across 6 regions (NL, US, UK, MA, IN & NZ) so knowledge of set up and/or dealing with local labour laws in these and other regions is advantageous. Otherwise, the ability to be astute and malleable in setting up new processes will be a must.
requirements:
Responsibilities

  • Oversee the recruitment process, work alongside hiring managers and leadership team on the end to end process of hiring new talent through our ATS Recruitee.
  • Oversee and manage all People Ops, including but not limited to; payroll, pension & sick leave management, on/off-boarding, 
  • Ensure a smooth execution of performance & review cycles, compensation reviews, engagement survey in collaboration with leaders in the company. The appraisal system we're using is CultureAmp.
  • Develop and implement People strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy
  • Bridge management and employee relations by addressing demands, grievances or other issue
  • Support current and future business needs through the development, engagement, motivation and preservation of human capital
  • Develop and monitor overall HR strategies, systems, tactics and procedures across the organisation
  • Nurture a positive working environment
  • Assess learning and development needs, advise training programs and monitor on them
  • Report to management and provide decision support through HR metrics where possible at our size team
  • Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management together with our experienced People Ops officer

  • Proven working experience as People & HR Manager within at least the Netherlands as a main represented country 
  • People oriented, though results driven and experienced with People metrics
  • Knowledge of HR systems and databases
  • Ability to architect strategy along with leadership skills
  • Excellent active listening, negotiation and presentation skills
